English: and when He had given thanks, He broke it and said, “Take, eat; this is My body which is broken for you; do this in remembrance of Me.”
Bahnar: krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei na phĕ hloi 'bĕng mi 'noh păng khan: “'Bĕng âu boih akâu Inh. Akâu Inh âu boih wă pơchah yua kơ iĕm. Iĕm kư̆m athei pơm thoi âu ling-lang wă 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ Inh.”

English: In the same manner He also took the cup after supper, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in My blood. This do, as often as you drink it, in remembrance of Me.”
Bahnar: Kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sŏng sa Sư iŏk minh pôm kơchŏk đak hơmu păng khan: “Kơchŏk đak hơmu âu boih pham Inh wă lĕch tang ăn lu iĕm. Thoi noh na 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih iĕm đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch. Rim wơ̆t iĕm huch đak âu wă kơ iĕm 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ Inh.”

English: For as often as you eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim the Lord’s death till He comes.
Bahnar: Na đơ̆ng sơ̆ truh năr Sư jur ning-mônh rim wơ̆t bơ̆n huch sa đak păng 'bĕng 'noh, wă khan bơ̆n pơm tơ'bôh kơ đe tơdrong Sư lôch tang bơ̆n.
Kơlih kơ thoi noh na bơngai bu huch sa đak păng 'bĕng âu kư̆ kă, bơngai 'noh sư dang wă pơjăm akâu păng pham Yêsu.

English: But let a man examine himself, and so let him eat of the bread and drink of the cup.
Bahnar: Thoi noh boih na rim 'nu bơ̆n athei tơchĕng lăng lăm akâu bơ̆n kơdih 'mơ̆i wă kơ băt bơ̆n gơh huch sa đak păng 'bĕng 'noh dah ưh.

English: For he who eats and drinks in an unworthy manner eats and drinks judgment to himself, not discerning the Lord’s body.
Bahnar: Dah bơngai bu huch sa kư̆ kă ưh kơ tơchĕng kơ đak păng 'bĕng noh wă khan akâu Yêsu, bơngai 'noh 'Bok Kei-Dei gô ăn kơ sư đei tơdrong chhŭr nuih.

English: For this reason many are weak and sick among you, and many sleep.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ iĕm pơm thoi noh na dang ei iĕm đei tơdrong chhŭr nuih pơm kơ iĕm jĭ jăn kư̆m đei bơngai mơ'nah lôch hloi.

English: For if we would judge ourselves, we would not be judged.
Bahnar: Dah bơ̆n tơchĕng lăng lăm jơhngơ̆m bơ̆n hơdrol boih, lei 'Bok Kei-Dei huay kơ ăn kơ bơ̆n đei tơdrong chhŭr nuih kiơ.

English: But when we are judged, we are chastened by the Lord, that we may not be condemned with the world.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ bơ̆n đei tơdrong chhŭr nuih thoi noh wă kơ bơ̆n tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch, na Sư huay kơ phak bơ̆n hơdai lu bơngai ala teh âu ning-mônh.

English: Therefore, my brethren, when you come together to eat, wait for one another.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ thoi noh na mưh trŏ kơ iĕm wă sŏng sa, iĕm athei tơgô băl 'mơ̆i.

English: But if anyone is hungry, let him eat at home, lest you come together for judgment. And the rest I will set in order when I come.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu năm sŏng sa hơdai hăm iĕm kiơ̆ kơ hơlŏng klak sư kơdih, bơngai 'noh iĕm athei sư brŏk sa tơ hnam sư kơdih đĕch 'lơ̆ng hloh, wă kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei huay kơ ăn kơ iĕm đei tơdrong chhŭr nuih. Gah tơdrong nai mă đêl iĕm jet inh 'noh gô inh năm tơ iĕm dơning dơmônh inh bơtho iĕm.

English: Now concerning spiritual gifts, brethren, I do not want you to be ignorant
Bahnar: Ơ 'nhŏng oh, dang ei inh wă roi ăn kơ iĕm mă nhên gah tơdrong hơgei Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ăn kơ bơ̆n wă jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: You know that you were Gentiles, carried away to these dumb idols, however you were led.
Bahnar: Iĕm kư̆m băt mơ̆n hơtai iĕm tam mă lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆, iĕm ling-lang gô mơ̆ng kơ đe dui ba iĕm kơkuh kơ rup yang mă ưh kơ gơh pơma.

English: Therefore I make known to you that no one speaking by the Spirit of God calls Jesus accursed, and no one can say that Jesus is Lord except by the Holy Spirit.
Bahnar: Na inh wă roi ăn kơ iĕm dang ei thoi âu: Bơngai bu gơnang kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm ăn kơ Sư pơma, bơngai 'noh sư ưh kơ đei layơ wă pơjăm pơjuă Yêsu ôh. Păng dôm lu bơngai mă krao Yêsu Kră Yang sư, sư pơma thoi noh yua kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng bơtho sư pơma thoi noh. Bơngai bu ưh kơ đei Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng, bơngai 'noh sư ưh kơ đei layơ pơma thoi noh ôh.

English: There are diversities of gifts, but the same Spirit.
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ăn kơ bơ̆n lơ tơdrong hơgei wă kơ gơh jang tơdrong Sư, mă-lei dôm tơdrong 'noh đơ̆ng lăp minh 'nu Sư đĕch ăn kơ bơ̆n.

English: There are differences of ministries, but the same Lord.
Bahnar: Rim 'nu kơ bơ̆n đei phara tơdrong jang, mă rim tơdrong jang bơ̆n tă jang tơdrong Kră Yang Yêsu Krist ngăl.

English: And there are diversities of activities, but it is the same God who works all in all.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Sư gơh tơgŭm bơ̆n phara tơdrong hơgei, mă-lei lăp minh 'nu 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch gơh tơgŭm đĭ-đăng kơ bơ̆n lăm tôm tơdrong.

English: But the manifestation of the Spirit is given to each one for the profit of all
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm rim 'nu bơngai wă jang tơdrong Sư, wă kơ bơ̆n gơh tơgŭm dih băl dơ̆ng.

English: for to one is given the word of wisdom through the Spirit, to another the word of knowledge through the same Spirit
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ăn kơ bơngai âu đon hơgei wă kơ năm chă bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei; Sư kư̆m ăn kơ bơngai to hlôh wao tôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă kơ gơh năm chă bơtho đe mơ̆n.

English: to another faith by the same Spirit, to another gifts of healings by the same Spirit
Bahnar: Sư ăn kơ bơngai 'nâu đei đon lui kơjăp păng Sư kư̆m ăn kơ bơngai to gơh pơklaih bơngai jĭ jăn.

English: to another the working of miracles, to another prophecy, to another discerning of spirits, to another different kinds of tongues, to another the interpretation of tongues.
Bahnar: Sư ăn kơ bơngai âu gơh pơm tơdrong mơsêh; Sư ăn kơ bơngai to gơh pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei. Sư kư̆m ăn kơ bơngai mơ'nah băt kơnăl kơ bơngai bu pơma yua kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm, bơngai bu ưh. Sư kư̆m đei ăn kơ bơngai mơ'nah gơh pơma nơ̆r hlĭch mă ưh kơ tam băt đơ̆ng sơ̆; Sư kư̆m ăn kơ bơngai nai gơh hlôh nơ̆r 'noh wă kơ tơblơ̆ ăn kơ đe.

English: But one and the same Spirit works all these things, distributing to each one individually as He wills.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng đĕch ăn kơ bơ̆n tôm tơdrong hơgei 'noh, Sư asong kơ rim 'nu bơngai bu kiơ̆ kơ Sư wă.

English: For as the body is one and has many members, but all the members of that one body, being many, are one body, so also is Christ.
Bahnar: Akâu jăn kon bơngai bơ̆n đei lơ chăl, mă-lei hơdôm tŏ chăl 'noh pơjing kơ minh 'nu bơngai đĕch, thoi noh boih na đĭ-đăng lu bơ̆n bơngai lui kơ Yêsu Krist kư̆m lei-lăi thoi noh mơ̆n, bơ̆n jing minh jơhngơ̆m minh đon akŭm păng Yêsu Krist.

English: For by one Spirit we were all baptized into one body—whether Jews or Greeks, whether slaves or free—and have all been made to drink into one Spirit.
Bahnar: Na đĭ rim khŭl bơngai, bơngai Juđê, bơngai khŭl nai, mă bơngai đĭch đe, mă bơngai rơngei, dah bơ̆n lui kơ Yêsu Krist, Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng pơm 'batem kơ bơ̆n pơgơ̆p bơ̆n jing minh jơhngơ̆m minh đon dih băl. Sư minh 'nu đĕch, mă-lei đĭ-đăng kơ bơ̆n iŏk Sư.

English: For in fact the body is not one member but many.
Bahnar: Akâu jăn kon bơngai bơ̆n ưh kơ sĭ minh chăl đĕch ôh, đei lơ chăl tơpă.

English: If the foot should say, “Because I am not a hand, I am not of the body,” is it therefore not of the body?
Bahnar: Pơtih gia jơ̆ng bơ̆n pơma khan: “Kơlih kơ inh ưh kơ yua thoi ti, na inh kư̆m dang ưh pă yua kơ akâu.” 'Bơ̆r sư pơma thoi noh ră, mă-lei sư ưh kơ gơh achăng tŭk akâu ôh.

English: And if the ear should say, “Because I am not an eye, I am not of the body,” is it therefore not of the body?
Bahnar: Dah đon bơ̆n dơ̆ng khan: “Kơlih kơ inh ưh kơ yua thoi măt, na inh kư̆m dang lĕ pă yua kơ akâu.” Sư khan thoi noh ră, mă-lei sư ưh kơ gơh achăng tŭk akâu ôh.

English: If the whole body were an eye, where would be the hearing? If the whole were hearing, where would be the smelling?
Bahnar: Pơtih gia dah 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing akâu bơ̆n đei pôm klong măt đĕch, lei thoi yơ bơ̆n gơh kơtơ̆ng tôm tơdrong re? Dah akâu bơ̆n đei pôm đon đĕch lu nai ưh kơ đei, lei thoi yơ bơ̆n gơh băt kơ 'bâu?

English: But now God has set the members, each one of them, in the body just as He pleased.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ thoi noh na 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing akâu bơ̆n đei lơ chăl phara kơdih kơdih kiơ̆ thoi Sư wă.

English: And if they were all one member, where would the body be?
Bahnar: Dah Sư pơjing akâu bơ̆n lăp minh chăl đĕch lei akâu bơ̆n ưh kơ tôm ôh.

English: But now indeed there are many members, yet one body.
Bahnar: Sư pơjing ăn kơ bơ̆n lăp minh pôm akâu, mă-lei mă minh pôm akâu 'noh đei lơ chăl.

English: And the eye cannot say to the hand, “I have no need of you”; nor again the head to the feet, “I have no need of you.”
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ thoi noh na măt bơ̆n ưh kơ đei layơ wă khan kơ ti bơ̆n khan: “Inh ưh kơ kăl kơ e ôh.” Kơ̆l bơ̆n kư̆m ưh kơ đei layơ wă khan kơ jơ̆ng bơ̆n khan: “Inh ưh kơ kăl kơ e ôh.”

English: No, much rather, those members of the body which seem to be weaker are necessary.
Bahnar: Dôm chăl lăm akâu bơ̆n mă bơ̆n lăng ưh kơ gan kăl ră mă-lei bơ̆n kư̆m kăl yua kơ sư mơ̆n.

English: And those members of the body which we think to be less honorable, on these we bestow greater honor; and our unpresentable parts have greater modesty
Bahnar: Dôm chăl lăm akâu bơ̆n mă bơ̆n lăng ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng, bơ̆n athei wei-lăng sư, pơhrŭk kơ sư hơbĕn ao mă 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ lu chăl nai.

English: but our presentable parts have no need. But God composed the body, having given greater honor to that part which lacks it
Bahnar: Mă-lei dôm lu chăl nai bơ̆n lăng sư 'lơ̆ng rŏ bơ̆n huay kăl kơ pơhrŭk kơ sư hơbĕn ao. 'Bok Kei-Dei boih pơjing akâu jăn bơ̆n thoi noh wă kơ bơ̆n wei-lăng mă 'lơ̆ng 'biơ̆ dôm lu chăl mă bơ̆n lăng ưh kơ gan 'lơ̆ng rŏ.

English: that there should be no schism in the body, but that the members should have the same care for one another.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lăm akâu bơ̆n ưh kơ đei tơdrong tơklah băl ôh, yua kơ dôm lu chăl akâu bơ̆n gơh wei-lăng tơgŭm dih băl ngăl.

English: And if one member suffers, all the members suffer with it; or if one member is honored, all the members rejoice with it.
Bahnar: Dah akâu bơ̆n minh chăl sư jĭ, lei jơ̆p kơ akâu bơ̆n kư̆m jĭ mơ̆n. Dah đe ư-ang kơ minh chăl akâu bơ̆n 'lơ̆ng rŏ, lei jơ̆p kơ trôm akâu bơ̆n kư̆m lăp đon mơ̆n.

English: Now you are the body of Christ, and members individually.
Bahnar: Akâu bơ̆n noh wă pơtih gia kơ dôm lu bơngai mă pơgơ̆p minh jơhngơ̆m minh đon hăm Yêsu Krist, na rim kơ chăl noh pơgơ̆p jing minh pôm akâu bơngai đĕch.

English: And God has appointed these in the church: first apostles, second prophets, third teachers, after that miracles, then gifts of healings, helps, administrations, varieties of tongues.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei asong kơ lu bơngai lui tôm kơ bơngai jang kiơ̆ thoi âu: Mă mônh 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn bơngai pơm jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu; mă 'bar Sư ăn bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r Sư; mă pêng Sư ăn bơngai bơtho tơdrong Sư; klaih kơ noh Sư ăn bơngai gơh pơm tơdrong mơsêh, bơngai gơh pơklaih đe jĭ jăn, đei bơngai gơh tơgŭm đe, đei bơngai gơh wei-lăng đe; Sư ăn kơ bơngai mơ'nah gơh pơma nơ̆r hlĭch wă ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Are all apostles? Are all prophets? Are all teachers? Are all workers of miracles?
Bahnar: Mă-lei đĭ-đăng kơ bơ̆n ưh kơ sĭ pơm jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu ngăl ôh; đĭ-đăng kơ bơ̆n ưh kơ sĭ bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei dah thây bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei ngăl ôh; đĭ-đăng kơ bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh pơm tơdrong mơsêh ngăl ôh

English: Do all have gifts of healings? Do all speak with tongues? Do all interpret?
Bahnar: dah pơklaih bơngai jĭ jăn, dah pơma nơ̆r hlĭch kơ bôl, dah tơblơ̆ ăn kơ đe nơ̆r mă hlĭch 'noh ngăl ôh. 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ bơngai mơ'nah gơh jang tơdrong âu mơ'nah gơh jang tơdrong to.

English: But earnestly desire the best gifts. And yet I show you a more excellent way.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lăm dôm tơdrong jang 'noh, bơ̆n athei apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ bơ̆n tơdrong jang mă kăl yua 'biơ̆. Mă-lei dang ei inh wă bơtho iĕm gah tơdrong mă kăl tơpă.

English: Though I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, but have not love, I have become sounding brass or a clanging cymbal.
Bahnar: Dah inh gơh pơma tôm kơ nơ̆r kon bơngai păng nơ̆r linh jang kơpal plĕnh ti, mă-lei akâu inh ưh kơ băt 'mêm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm bôl buăl inh, lei 'bơ̆r inh pơma noh thoi lĕ kơ jơwa đe teh teng păng jơwa tŏk-rŏk đĕch.

English: And though I have the gift of prophecy, and understand all mysteries and all knowledge, and though I have all faith, so that I could remove mountains, but have not love, I am nothing.
Bahnar: Dah 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ inh gơh pơtruh nơ̆r Sư păng hlôh tôm tơdrong Sư tam lah tơ'bôh kơ đe đơ̆ng sơ̆ păng dah Sư ăn kơ inh lui kơjăp sơkat kĕ hiŏng tơlơ̆ kông, mă khan Sư ăn kơ inh gơh hơgei dang 'noh ră, mă-lei dah inh ưh kơ băt 'mêm kơ Sư hăm bôl buăl inh, thoi noh akâu inh âu ưh kơ yua kiơ ôh.

English: And though I bestow all my goods to feed the poor, and though I give my body to be burned, but have not love, it profits me nothing.
Bahnar: Dah inh wă kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon kơ inh na inh asong đĭ-đăng mŭk tơmam inh kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin, klaih kơ noh inh pơm soh pơyơ̆r akâu inh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, mă-lei inh ưh kơ băt 'mêm kơ bôl buăl inh, tơdrong inh pơm noh ưh kơ đei yua kiơ kơ inh ôh.

English: Love suffers long and is kind; love does not envy; love does not parade itself, is not puffed up
Bahnar: Bơngai bu 'mêm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm bôl buăl sư, đe pơm kơnê̆ kơ sư, sư hreh đĕch; sư iŏk tơdrong iơ̆m dim ling-lang, sư ưh kơ klai kơ đe, sư huay kơ pơang akâu kơ đe

English: does not behave rudely, does not seek its own, is not provoked, thinks no evil
Bahnar: sư ưh kơ pơ'lŏ, sư ưh kơ pơ'brơh kơ đe, sư mơ̆ng kơ đe, sư ưh kơ pơjah, jơhngơ̆m sư huay kơ 'bônh kơ blĕk. Bơngai bu 'mêm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm bôl buăl sư, sư ưh kơ lah jô̆ yo kơ đe pơm kơnê̆ kơ sư ôh

English: does not rejoice in iniquity, but rejoices in the truth
Bahnar: sư ưh kơ lăp đon kơ tơdrong kơnê̆, sư lăp đon kơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu băt 'mêm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm bôl buăl sư, mă đe pơm kơnê̆ kơ sư, sư oei 'mêm kơ đe; đe areh kơ buăl sư mă-lei sư oei lui kơ nơ̆r buăl sư; păng sư lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wei-lăng sư lăm tôm tơdrong khŏm khŏm; mă đei tơdrong gleh pơmat-tat, sư oei khŏm adrin lui 'mơ̆i.

English: Love never fails. But whether there are prophecies, they will fail; whether there are tongues, they will cease; whether there is knowledge, it will vanish away.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu 'mêm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm bôl buăl sư, sư 'mêm tơpă ling-lang ưh kơ layơ tôch. Mă-lei gah tơdrong pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, ning-mônh gô tôch, yua kơ dang ei 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r Sư, mă-lei ning-mônh ưh pă kăl boih. Ahrei âu Sư ăn kơ lu mơ'nah gơh pơma nơ̆r hlĭch mă đe ưh kơ hlôh wă ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, mă-lei ning-mônh ưh pă yua boih. Dang ei ahrei âu Sư ăn kơ lu mơ'nah gơh hlôh wao tơdrong Sư nhên wă kơ gơh bơtho đe, mă-lei ning-mônh ưh pă kăl boih.

English: For we know in part and we prophesy in part.
Bahnar: Dang ei lu buăl bơ̆n mơ'nah 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu sư gơh hlôh wao tơdrong Sư, wă kơ chă năm bơtho đe; păng lu buăl bơ̆n mă Sư ăn pơtruh nơ̆r Sư, lu sư hlôh wao hloh kơ bơ̆n tơpă, na sư gơh bơtho ăn kơ bơ̆n.

English: But when that which is perfect has come, then that which is in part will be done away.
Bahnar: Mă-lei ning-mônh đĭ-đăng kơ bơ̆n gô hlôh wao tôm tơdrong, thoi noh na bơ̆n ưh pă kăl kơ đe bơtho bơ̆n dơ̆ng.

English: When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child; but when I became a man, I put away childish things.
Bahnar: Inh pơma pơtih gia kơ tơdrong noh thoi âu: Kơplah inh oei 'lơ̆p sơ̆, inh pơma thoi lu hơ'lơ̆p, đon inh hlôh wao thoi đon tơduă hơ'lơ̆p, mă-lei truh inh kră boih inh ưh pă kăl kơ tơdrong hơ'lơ̆p dơ̆ng.

English: For now we see in a mirror, dimly, but then face to face. Now I know in part, but then I shall know just as I also am known.
Bahnar: Dang ei bơ̆n băt tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ nhên ôh, mă-lei ning-mônh bơ̆n gô băt nhên tơpă, kư̆m thoi bơ̆n lăng muh măt đe tơ lăm amĭl mam ưh kơ gan nhên, mă-lei dah bơ̆n lăng tơklă muh măt sư bơ̆n gô băt nhên tơpă yơh. Tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei dang ei inh kư̆m ưh kơ hlôh tôm ôh, mă-lei ning-mônh inh gô hlôh tôm, kư̆m thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei hlôh tôm tơdrong inh dang ei mơ̆n.

English: And now abide faith, hope, love, these three; but the greatest of these is love.
Bahnar: Đei pêng tơdrong bơ̆n athei wei ling-lang, ưh kơ đei layơ tôch: Bơ̆n athei lui kơjăp, chang hơmĕng dôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn kơ bơ̆n, athei băt 'mêm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm bôl buăl bơ̆n; mă-lei athei băt 'mêm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm bôl buăl bơ̆n kăl hloh.

English: Pursue love, and desire spiritual gifts, but especially that you may prophesy.
Bahnar: Na bơ̆n ling-lang athei băt 'mêm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm bôl buăl bơ̆n păng bơ̆n athei apinh Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng asong kơ bơ̆n tơdrong hơgei Sư, mă loi gơh pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: For he who speaks in a tongue does not speak to men but to God, for no one understands him; however, in the spirit he speaks mysteries.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n 'bôh đe bu ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm nơ̆r hlĭch mă bơ̆n tam mă kơtơ̆ng păng ưh kơ hlôh, 'noh lu sư pơma ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, ưh kơ sĭ lu sư pơma kơ lu bơ̆n kon bơngai ôh. Tơdrong pơma nơ̆r hlĭch noh đơ̆ng Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơbăt kơ lu sư.

English: But he who prophesies speaks edification and exhortation and comfort to men.
Bahnar: Mă-lei gah lu bơngai mă pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, sư bơtho tơblơ̆ tơblang kơ kon bơngai bơ̆n wă kơ hlôh na jing lui kơjăp hiôk huay pă ơh sơ'ngon.

English: He who speaks in a tongue edifies himself, but he who prophesies edifies the church.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă ư-ang kơ Kră Yang pơma nơ̆r hlĭch, sư atŏk jơhngơ̆m lui sư kơdih đĕch, sư ưh kơ atŏk jơhngơ̆m bôl lui ôh. Mă-lei bơngai mă pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, sư pơhiôk atŏk jơhngơ̆m lui bôl.

English: I wish you all spoke with tongues, but even more that you prophesied; for he who prophesies is greater than he who speaks with tongues, unless indeed he interprets, that the church may receive edification.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă ư-ang kơ Kră Yang pơhiôk akâu sư kơdih noh, inh kư̆m wă kơ iĕm gơh rok sư mơ̆n, mă-lei iĕm athei pơtruh ăn kơ đe tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei 'noh kăl hloh kơ tơdrong pơhiôk akâu kơdih. Mă-lei dah bơngai mă ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh pơma nơ̆r hlĭch 'noh gơh tơblang kơ lu bôl lui lei kư̆m kăl mơ̆n, yua kơ sư gơh pơhiôk atŏk ăn kơ jơhngơ̆m lui bôl.

English: But now, brethren, if I come to you speaking with tongues, what shall I profit you unless I speak to you either by revelation, by knowledge, by prophesying, or by teaching?
Bahnar: Ơ 'nhŏng oh, dah inh năm chă hơpong kơ iĕm na inh nŏng pơma ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei păng nơ̆r hlĭch mă iĕm ưh kơ hlôh, tơdrong inh ư-ang noh ưh kơ yua kiơ kơ iĕm ôh. Mă-lei dah inh bơtho tơblơ̆ tơblang ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei mă iĕm tam mă hlôh đơ̆ng sơ̆, lei akâu inh yua kơ iĕm tơpă.

English: Even things without life, whether flute or harp, when they make a sound, unless they make a distinction in the sounds, how will it be known what is piped or played?
Bahnar: Pơtih gia tơdrong bơ̆n hlôm tơgiĕp dah reh brŏ, tơdah bơ̆n hlôm dah reh na re atŏ hloi, lei ưh kơ đei bu băt bơ̆n wă hlôm dah reh tơdrong kiơ ôh.

English: For if the trumpet makes an uncertain sound, who will prepare for battle?
Bahnar: Pơtih gia kơ khŭl linh tơblah, tơdah bơngai mă chĕp keng hlôm ưh kơ tơdra kơ đe nai băt, lei thoi yơ bôl gơh kơchăng kơ tơdrong tơblah?

English: So likewise you, unless you utter by the tongue words easy to understand, how will it be known what is spoken? For you will be speaking into the air.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơma nơ̆r hlĭch kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n, tơdah bơ̆n nŏng kơ pơma mă-lei đe nai ưh kơ hlôh minh tơdrong kiơ, thoi yơ gơh yua kơ bôl?

English: There are, it may be, so many kinds of languages in the world, and none of them is without significance.
Bahnar: Đei lơ bơngai tơ ala teh âu pơma nơ̆r phara, rim nơ̆r pơma sư hlôh kơdih kơdih.

English: Therefore, if I do not know the meaning of the language, I shall be a foreigner to him who speaks, and he who speaks will be a foreigner to me.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah bơ̆n tơ'bơ̆p bơngai tơmoi pơma nơ̆r pha kơ bơ̆n, bơ̆n ưh kơ hlôh nơ̆r sư pơma, bơ̆n lăng sư bơngai tơmoi đĕch păng sư lăng bơ̆n kư̆m lei-lăi.

English: Even so you, since you are zealous for spiritual gifts, let it be for the edification of the church that you seek to excel.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na inh wă khan kơ iĕm thoi âu: Iĕm wă tơpă mơ̆n kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm iĕm hơgei tôm tơdrong, mă-lei iĕm athei apinh tơdrong hơgei gơh tơgŭm kơ bơ̆n bơngai lui.

English: Therefore let him who speaks in a tongue pray that he may interpret.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na bơngai mă Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm sư gơh pơma nơ̆r hlĭch ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei 'noh, sư athei krao khan apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm sư hơgei hlôh tôm tơdrong sư pơma nơ̆r hlĭch 'noh 'mơ̆i, na sư gơh tơblang ăn kơ lu bơngai lui.

English: For if I pray in a tongue, my spirit prays, but my understanding is unfruitful.
Bahnar: Phŏ bơ̆n gơh pơma krao khan nơ̆r hlĭch pơhiôk lăm jơhngơ̆m kơdih, mă-lei bơ̆n ưh kơ hlôh tơdrong bơ̆n pơma noh wă khan kiơ, bơ̆n kư̆m bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei lăm jơhngơ̆m bơ̆n mơ̆n, mă-lei đon bơ̆n ưh kơ hlôh wao.

English: What is the conclusion then? I will pray with the spirit, and I will also pray with the understanding. I will sing with the spirit, and I will also sing with the understanding.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n tơchĕng thoi yơ wă kơ trŏ lei? Inh wă kơ bơ̆n krao khan pơhiôk lăm jơhngơ̆m kơdih păng inh wă kơ bơ̆n krao khan gơh hlôh wao tơdrong bơ̆n krao khan. Inh wă kơ bơ̆n hơri bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơhiôk lăm jơhngơ̆m kơdih păng inh wă kơ bơ̆n hơri kư̆m hlôh tơdrong bơ̆n hơri mơ̆n.

English: Otherwise, if you bless with the spirit, how will he who occupies the place of the uninformed say “Amen” at your giving of thanks, since he does not understand what you say?
Bahnar: Dah bu krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei yua nơ̆r hlĭch pơhiôk lăm jơhngơ̆m sư kơdih đĕch, lei thoi yơ bôl bơ̆n mă ưh kơ hlôh hơdai wang bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơdrong sư ưh kơ hlôh?

English: For you indeed give thanks well, but the other is not edified.
Bahnar: Tơdrong bơ̆n krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi noh 'lơ̆ng ră mơ̆n, mă-lei ưh kơ yua kơ bôl.

English: I thank my God I speak with tongues more than you all
Bahnar: Inh bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư ăn kơ inh gơh pơma nơ̆r hlĭch lơ hloh kơ iĕm.

English: yet in the church I would rather speak five words with my understanding, that I may teach others also, than ten thousand words in a tongue.
Bahnar: Mă-lei kơplah bơ̆n akŭm inh ưh kơ wă ôh pơma nơ̆r hlĭch. Inh pơma kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r bôl băt lăp pơđăm tŏ plei đĕch kư̆m dang lĕ hloh loi kơ mơjĭt-rơbâu nơ̆r hlĭch mă inh gơh pơma 'noh.

English: Brethren, do not be children in understanding; however, in malice be babes, but in understanding be mature.
Bahnar: Ơ 'nhŏng oh, gah tơdrong iĕm 'maih pơma nơ̆r hlĭch, iĕm athei tơchĕng kiơ̆ đon kră, 'nĕ pă kiơ̆ thoi đon bơngai nge. Bơ̆n băt kơ lu bơngai nge ưh kơ gơh pơm kơnê̆ kơ đe, dah bơ̆n kiơ̆ thoi noh 'lơ̆ng mơ̆n, mă-lei bơ̆n 'nĕ kơ kiơ̆ kơ đon sư tơchĕng, yua kơ sư ưh kơ hlôh ôh.

English: In the law it is written: “With men of other tongues and other lips I will speak to this people; And yet, for all that, they will not hear Me,” says the Lord.
Bahnar: Lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan boih thoi âu: “Inh wơh lu bơngai tơmoi yua nơ̆r lu sư kơdih bơtho pơđep lu bơngai Isơrael tơgŭm inh, mă-lei lu bơngai Isơrael kư̆m ưh kơ chu 'mơ̆i.”

English: Therefore tongues are for a sign, not to those who believe but to unbelievers; but prophesying is not for unbelievers but for those who believe.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na 'Bok Kei-Dei yua nơ̆r hlĭch wă tơbăt ăn tơdrong Sư wă phak kơ lu bơngai mă mơ̆ng đunh boih mă ưh kơ chu lui kơ nơ̆r Sư. Gah lu bơngai chu lui kơ nơ̆r Sư, ưh kơ kăl kơ đe pơma tơbăt ăn tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak ôh, lu sư kăl pôm lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch; mă-lei ưh kơ sĭ pơtruh kơ lu bơngai mă kuă kơ lui ôh, pơtruh kơ lu bơngai mă lui boih.

English: Therefore if the whole church comes together in one place, and all speak with tongues, and there come in those who are uninformed or unbelievers, will they not say that you are out of your mind?
Bahnar: Pơtih gia thoi âu dơ̆ng: Dah kơplah iĕm oei akŭm băl, na đĭ-đăng kơ iĕm pơma hloi nơ̆r hlĭch, lu bơngai mă ưh tam kơtơ̆ng tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu bơngai mă ưh tam lui, lu sư 'bôh tơdrong iĕm pơma nơ̆r hlĭch 'noh lu sư khan iĕm wơnh đĕch hăm trŏ?

English: But if all prophesy, and an unbeliever or an uninformed person comes in, he is convinced by all, he is convicted by all.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah lu sư mơ̆ng đĭ kơ iĕm pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, lei lu sư kư̆m băt kơdih bơngai yoch, yua kơ đĭ-đăng kơ iĕm tơbăt kơ lu sư mă nhên.

English: And thus the secrets of his heart are revealed; and so, falling down on his face, he will worship God and report that God is truly among you.
Bahnar: Păng dah lu sư băt kơdih bơngai yoch tih dang yơ, lu sư kư̆m sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng kơkuh hli kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n păng lu sư kư̆m băt kơ iĕm bơngai 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm.

English: How is it then, brethren? Whenever you come together, each of you has a psalm, has a teaching, has a tongue, has a revelation, has an interpretation. Let all things be done for edification.
Bahnar: Ơ 'nhŏng oh, iĕm băt tơdrong inh pơma hei thoi noh boih, na iĕm wă pơđâu băl thoi yơ dơ̆ng gah tơdrong iĕm wă akŭm? Kơplah iĕm akŭm, bơngai âu sư wă hơri bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, bơngai noh sư wă bơtho, bơngai to sư wă pơtruh nơ̆r đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei, bơngai nai wă pơma nơ̆r hlĭch ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, bơngai nai dơ̆ng wă tơblơ̆ tơdrong pơma nơ̆r hlĭch. Mă-lei dôm tơdrong iĕm pơm noh inh athei iĕm pơm mă trŏ wă atŏk jơhngơ̆m bôl buăl bơngai lui.

English: If anyone speaks in a tongue, let there be two or at the most three, each in turn, and let one interpret.
Bahnar: Dah iĕm wă kơ bơngai mă gơh pơma nơ̆r hlĭch ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei iung pơma kơ iĕm, lei iĕm athei ăn lăp 'bar 'nu dah pêng 'nu đĕch păng sư athei pơma bơlơh băl mơ-minh 'nu, ưh kơ gơh iung pơma minh 'măng hơdai hloi ôh. Păng athei đei bơngai mă gơh tơblơ̆ nơ̆r hlĭch sư pơma noh mơ̆n.

English: But if there is no interpreter, let him keep silent in church, and let him speak to himself and to God.
Bahnar: Dah ưh kơ đei bơngai gơh tơblơ̆ nơ̆r hlĭch noh, iĕm 'nĕ kơ ăn sư pơma kơ iĕm nơ̆r noh hŏ, iĕm athei sư krao khan kơdrô̆ sư kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch.

English: Let two or three prophets speak, and let the others judge.
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai pơtruh kơ iĕm nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, iĕm athei lu sư bơtho lăp 'bar 'nu dah pêng 'nu păng ăn kơ tơduă lu sư bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei tơchĕng tơdrong bơngai mă dơ̆ng bơtho noh hăm 'blep trŏ kơ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă dah ưh.

English: But if anything is revealed to another who sits by, let the first keep silent.
Bahnar: Kơplah bôl sư oei bơtho, dah 'Bok Kei-Dei tơbăt dơ̆ng kơ bôl sư nai tơdrong kiơ wă pơma, bơngai mă pơma hơdrol noh sư athei krŏt mơ̆ng kơ bôl sư pơma dơ̆ng 'mơ̆i.

English: For you can all prophesy one by one, that all may learn and all may be encouraged.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm bơngai mă 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih wă pơtruh nơ̆r Sư kơ bôl buăl, đĭ-đăng kơ iĕm gơh bơtho mơ̆n, mă-lei iĕm athei iung pơma bơlơh băl mơ-minh 'nu, thoi noh na đĭ-đăng kơ bôl gơh băt nhên tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei na jing hiôk chơt.

English: And the spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, dah 'Bok Kei-Dei tơbăt ăn kơ sư tơdrong kiơ wă pơtruh ăn kơ bơngai lui, bơngai noh kư̆m gơh gô bôl bơtho đang 'mơ̆i na sư gơh iung pơma kơ đe

English: For God is not the author of confusion but of peace, as in all the churches of the saints.
Bahnar: yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ wă kơ bơ̆n akŭm kư̆ kă ôh, Sư wă kơ bơ̆n akŭm 'blep trŏ thoi Sư wă.

English: Let your women keep silent in the churches, for they are not permitted to speak; but they are to be submissive, as the law also says.
Bahnar: Lăm iĕm akŭm, lu bơngai drŏ-kăn athei hreh ưh kơ gơh iung pơma. Lu bơngai lui mă akŭm jơ̆p-jang anih kư̆m pơm thoi noh mơ̆n. Lu bơngai drŏ-kăn athei lui yom kơ bơngai drŏ-nglo kư̆m thoi tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă.

English: And if they want to learn something, let them ask their own husbands at home; for it is shameful for women to speak in church.
Bahnar: Dah lu bơngai drŏ-kăn ưh kơ hlôh tơdrong kiơ kiơ na wă jet đe, sư athei jet klo sư 'bơ̆t brŏk tơ hnam kơnh đĕch, 'nĕ kơ jet kơplah oei akŭm. Bơngai drŏ-kăn pơma kơplah iĕm akŭm ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng ôh.

English: Or did the word of God come originally from you? Or was it you only that it reached?
Bahnar: Iĕm khan iĕm pơm tơm tơdrong bơtho nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei hă? 'Bok Kei-Dei wă tơbăt kơ pôm iĕm đĕch tơdrong Sư dah kiơ? Ưh ôh.

English: If anyone thinks himself to be a prophet or spiritual, let him acknowledge that the things which I write to you are the commandments of the Lord.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu băt kơdih sư khan sư bơngai pơtruh tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei kơ đe păng lu bơngai bu nai khan sư đei Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm sư hơgei gơh pơm tơdrong kiơ kiơ, lu bơngai noh sư athei băt tôm tơdrong inh chih ată đơ̆ng Yêsu Krist tơpă yơh.

English: But if anyone is ignorant, let him be ignorant.
Bahnar: Dah bơngai bu lăm lu iĕm ưh kơ băt kơ inh chih ată tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei kơ iĕm tơpă, lei 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m ưh kơ băt kơ bơngai noh lui kơ Sư ôh.

English: Therefore, brethren, desire earnestly to prophesy, and do not forbid to speak with tongues.
Bahnar: Ơ 'nhŏng oh, iĕm athei krao khan apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm gơh pơtruh nơ̆r Sư ling-lang. Tơdrong lu bôl pơma nơ̆r hlĭch noh iĕm 'nĕ mah khă sư dêh hŏ.

English: Let all things be done decently and in order.
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm athei akŭm 'blep trŏ thoi Kră Yang wă, 'nĕ pă akŭm kư̆ kă.

English: Moreover, brethren, I declare to you the gospel which I preached to you, which also you received and in which you stand
Bahnar: Ơ lu 'nhŏng oh, 'nâu inh wă tơ'blŏk ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng mă inh đei bơtho ăn kơ lu iĕm boih, lu iĕm lui boih păng oei kơjăp lăm tơdrong lui dang ei 'noh.

English: by which also you are saved, if you hold fast that word which I preached to you—unless you believed in vain.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng 'nâu, na iĕm gơh klaih. Dang ei đĭ kơ iĕm hăm oei răk tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng mă đêl inh bơtho kơ lu iĕm dah ưh? Tơ̆ng ưh, tơdrong lu iĕm lui ưh kơ đei yua kiơ ôh.

English: For I delivered to you first of all that which I also received: that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures
Bahnar: Inh bơtho kơ iĕm sơ̆ tơdrong mă kăl dêh đêl Kră Yang Yêsu Krist ăn kơ inh, khan 'Bok Krist lôch yua kơ tơdrong yoch bơ̆n 'blep thoi đe chih khan lê̆ hơdrol boih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: and that He was buried, and that He rose again the third day according to the Scriptures
Bahnar: Đe 'bŭ Sư; kơtĕch pêng năr Sư iung arih dơ̆ng 'blep thoi đe chih khan lê̆ hơdrol boih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.

English: and that He was seen by Cephas, then by the twelve.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu Krist tơ'bôh akâu Sư kơ Pêtrôs păng tơ'bôh kơ mơjĭt-'bar 'nu jơ̆ng 'bang Sư.

English: After that He was seen by over five hundred brethren at once, of whom the greater part remain to the present, but some have fallen asleep.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh lăm minh 'măng Sư tơ'bôh kơ loi pơđăm-hrĕng 'nu bơngai lui kơ Sư. Mă lu bơngai 'noh dang ei kư̆m oei arih, kư̆m đei mơ'nah lôch mơ̆n.

English: After that He was seen by James, then by all the apostles.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh dơ̆ng Sư tơ'bôh kơ Yakơ păng đĭ-đăng bơngai jơ̆ng 'bang Sư.

English: Then last of all He was seen by me also, as by one born out of due time.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t tuch-luch Sư tơ'bôh kơ inh, inh thoi lĕ kơ minh 'nu kon nge đe tơpŭ hloh kơ khei 'năr

English: For I am the least of the apostles, who am not worthy to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.
Bahnar: yua kơ inh bơngai jơ̆ng 'bang iĕ hloh kơ lu jơ̆ng 'bang nai. Inh ưh kơ hơnhŏ đe krao inh jơ̆ng 'bang Sư ôh, yua kơ inh đei pơrăm lu bơngai lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: But by the grace of God I am what I am, and His grace toward me was not in vain; but I labored more abundantly than they all, yet not I, but the grace of God which was with me.
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei mơnat kơ inh. 'Bok Kei-Dei mơnat kơ inh ưh kơ sĭ Sư mơnat đĕch ôh, Sư tơgŭm ăn kơ inh bơ̆jang lơ hloh kơ lu đe nai. Mă-lei ưh kơ trŏ kơ inh kơdih ôh, 'noh yua kơ đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei mơnat na Sư tơgŭm ăn kơ inh.

English: Therefore, whether it was I or they, so we preach and so you believed.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong inh 'nao bơtho iĕm hei gah tơdrong Yêsu Krist iung arih đơ̆ng lôch, dôm lu nhôn bơngai jơ̆ng 'bang, mă inh, mă lu sư, tơdrong bơtho lu nhôn lei-lăi đĕch păng tơdrong lui iĕm kư̆m lei-lăi thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: Now if Christ is preached that He has been raised from the dead, how do some among you say that there is no resurrection of the dead?
Bahnar: Thoi noh dah nhôn bơtho khan Yêsu Krist iung arih đơ̆ng lôch, lei lơliơ lăm lu iĕm mơ'nah khan ưh kơ đei bu gơh iung arih đơ̆ng lôch?

English: But if there is no resurrection of the dead, then Christ is not risen.
Bahnar: Dah ưh kơ đei bu gơh iung arih, lei Yêsu Krist kư̆m ưh kơ đei iung arih ôh.

English: And if Christ is not risen, then our preaching is empty and your faith is also empty.
Bahnar: Dah Yêsu Krist ưh kơ iung arih đơ̆ng lôch, thoi noh tơdrong nhôn bơtho jing tơdrong kơđei păng bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh gơnang kơ Yêsu ôh.

English: Yes, and we are found false witnesses of God, because we have testified of God that He raised up Christ, whom He did not raise up—if in fact the dead do not rise.
Bahnar: Dah ưh kơ đei bu iung arih đơ̆ng lôch, thoi noh 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m ưh kơ tơiung arih Yêsu Krist ôh păng lu nhôn dang lĕ bơngai pơm kơdranh hơlĕnh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch, yua kơ nhôn khan 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih Yêsu Krist đơ̆ng lôch boih.

English: For if the dead do not rise, then Christ is not risen.
Bahnar: Dah ưh kơ đei bu gơh iung arih đơ̆ng lôch, thoi noh Yêsu Krist kư̆m ưh kơ gơh iung arih đơ̆ng lôch mơ̆n.

English: And if Christ is not risen, your faith is futile; you are still in your sins!
Bahnar: Dah Yêsu Krist ưh kơ iung arih đơ̆ng lôch, thoi noh tơdrong lui iĕm ưh kơ đei yua kiơ păng iĕm kư̆m oei jrok kiơ̆ tơdrong yoch.

English: Then also those who have fallen asleep in Christ have perished.
Bahnar: Păng mă lu bơngai lui kơ Yêsu Krist, lu sư lôch boih, lu sư kư̆m hơdai hiong hiach mơ̆n.

English: If in this life only we have hope in Christ, we are of all men the most pitiable.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n lui kơ Yêsu Krist, bơ̆n gô arih ling-lang, mă-lei dah kiơ̆ kơ đe khan ưh kơ đei arih ling-lang, lei tơdrong arih bơ̆n 'noh pơmat-tat hloh kơ lu bôl nai đĕch.

English: But now Christ is risen from the dead, and has become the firstfruits of those who have fallen asleep.
Bahnar: Mă tơpă 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih Yêsu Krist boih, thoi noh bơ̆n băt 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m wă tơiung arih lu bơ̆n mơ̆n. Pơtih gia, Yêsu Krist thoi lĕ 'ba hrôih kơ lu bơngai mă lôch boih.

English: For since by man came death, by Man also came the resurrection of the dead.
Bahnar: Tơdrong lôch yua kơ đơ̆ng minh 'nu bơngai pơm yoch sơ̆, na đĭ-đăng bơngai gô lôch ngăl. Kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n, yua kơ đei minh 'nu bơngai gơh iung arih đơ̆ng lôch, na ning-mônh kon bơngai bơ̆n gô iung arih kư̆m lei-lăi thoi Sư mơ̆n.

English: For as in Adam all die, even so in Christ all shall be made alive.
Bahnar: Yua kơ bơ̆n đơ̆ng kon sâu 'bok Ađam, na đĭ-đăng bơngai lôch ngăl. Thoi noh mơ̆n, yua kơ bơ̆n lui kơ Yêsu Krist na đĭ-đăng bơ̆n ning-mônh 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m wă tơiung arih mơ̆n.

English: But each one in his own order: Christ the firstfruits, afterward those who are Christ’s at His coming.
Bahnar: Rim 'nu kơ bơ̆n athei gô lăp kơ khei 'năr. Yêsu Krist Sư thoi lĕ kơ 'ba hrôih, Sư iung arih hơdrol kơ bơ̆n. Mưh lăp kơ khei 'năr Sư wă jur tơ ala teh âu, đĭ-đăng bơngai lui iung arih kiơ̆ Sư.

English: Then comes the end, when He delivers the kingdom to God the Father, when He puts an end to all rule and all authority and power.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t 'noh boih năr tôch, na dôm lu bơngai juăt kơ pơgơ̆r păng dôm lu yang nai mă hơdai wang 'maih pơgơ̆r, năr 'noh kơnh lu sư gô thuơ kơ Yêsu Krist đĭ na Yêsu gô pơjao ăn kơ 'Bă Sư pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng tôm tơdrong.

English: For He must reign till He has put all enemies under His feet.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Yêsu pơgơ̆r truh tơ Sư blah rôp ba dôm lu bơngai mă ayăt kơ Yêsu lê̆ tơ kơnơl jơ̆ng Sư.

English: The last enemy that will be destroyed is death.
Bahnar: Mă tuch-luch ning-mônh 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơrăm tôm tơdrong kơnê̆ na bơ̆n ưh pă lôch dơ̆ng.

English: For “He has put all things under His feet.” But when He says “all things are put under Him,” it is evident that He who put all things under Him is excepted.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơrăm tôm tơdrong kơnê̆ yua kơ sơ̆p hla bơar Sư đei khan: “'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn kơ Kon Sư pơgơ̆r tôm tơdrong.” Mă-lei ưh kơ sĭ Yêsu Krist wă pơgơ̆r 'Bă Sư hai ôh.

English: Now when all things are made subject to Him, then the Son Himself will also be subject to Him who put all things under Him, that God may be all in all.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Kon Sư pơgơ̆r tôm tơdrong đang boih, na Kon Sư pơjao ăn kơ 'Bă Sư pơđĭ tôm tơdrong păng ăn kơ 'Bă Sư pơgơ̆r akâu Sư hai.

English: Otherwise, what will they do who are baptized for the dead, if the dead do not rise at all? Why then are they baptized for the dead?
Bahnar: Bĭ tơdrong âu dơ̆ng, lu bơngai mă iŏk 'batem boih, lu sư wă iŏk tang lu bơngai lui mă lôch boih ưh kơ tam iŏk 'batem, na dah lu bơngai lôch ưh kơ iung arih lei lơliơ sư wă iŏk 'batem tang lu bơngai lôch?

English: And why do we stand in jeopardy every hour?
Bahnar: Gah inh đe ling-lang wă pơm kơnê̆ kơ inh kơlih kơ inh adrin jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei. Na dah inh lôch ning-mônh ưh kơ đei iung arih đơ̆ng lôch, lei thoi yơ inh wă adrin jang thoi dang ei?

English: I affirm, by the boasting in you which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, I die daily.
Bahnar: Ơ 'nhŏng oh, inh wă roi tơbăt ăn kơ iĕm gah tơdrong đe wă pơrăm inh, na rim năr ưh kơ băt năr ayơ inh lôch, mă-lei inh hiôk tơpă lăm jơhngơ̆m inh yua kơ iĕm lui kơjăp kơ Kră Yang bơ̆n Yêsu Krist boih, na inh mah roi tơbăt ăn kơ iĕm thoi noh.

English: If, in the manner of men, I have fought with beasts at Ephesus, what advantage is it to me? If the dead do not rise, “Let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die!”
Bahnar: Inh đei tơdrong gleh truh kơ inh tơ Pơlei Êphêsô dang lĕ inh tơblah păng sem bri. Dah inh adrin tơblah păng sư, mă-lei inh ưh kơ tơchĕng tơdrong inh gô iung arih ning-mônh, lei tơdrong inh adrin 'noh ưh kơ đei yua kiơ kơ inh ôh. Dah 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ tơiung arih lu bơngai bơ̆n đơ̆ng lôch, lei bơ̆n kuă kơ kiơ kơ sa et phĭ mah rơkah rơkai chă tơdrong hiôk ling-lang, yua kơ bơ̆n wă lôch hiong hiơt thoi ei?

English: Do not be deceived: “Evil company corrupts good habits.”
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ kơ lui kơ lu bơngai wă pơlung iĕm, khan 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ wă tơiung arih bơngai lôch, kơnh đơ̆ng bơngai 'lơ̆ng oei hơdai bơngai kơnê̆ sư jing kơnê̆ lei-lăi.

English: Awake to righteousness, and do not sin; for some do not have the knowledge of God. I speak this to your shame.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei tơbral tơdrong yoch na jing 'lơ̆ng 'nĕ pă pơm tơdrong yoch đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp. Lu iĕm mơ'nah ưh kơ hlôh wao tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi yơ na iĕm mơlâu ưh?

English: But someone will say, “How are the dead raised up? And with what body do they come?”
Bahnar: Pơtih gia đei bơngai jet pơngiĕl khan: “Lơliơ bơngai lôch khan gơh iung arih dơ̆ng? Akâu bơ̆n jing thoi yơ dơ̆ng?”

English: Foolish one, what you sow is not made alive unless it dies.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu jet thoi noh bơngai 'noh sư ưh kơ hlôh ôh. Bơ̆n rei adrĕch tơ teh, sư lôch 'mơ̆i klaih kơ noh sư gô chăt.

English: And what you sow, you do not sow that body that shall be, but mere grain—perhaps wheat or some other grain.
Bahnar: Gah tơdrong bơ̆n rei adrĕch, pơtih gia adrĕch 'ba dah adrĕch găr nai, bơ̆n rei pôm găr sư đĕch tơ teh, ưh kơ sĭ bơ̆n hơloh rei tơnơm sư hloi ôh. Bơ̆n rei găr sư 'mơ̆i na đơ̆ng rŏng sư chăt jing đei tơnơm.

English: But God gives it a body as He pleases, and to each seed its own body.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ rim adrĕch chăt hla kiơ̆ thoi Sư pơjing sơ̆, rim adrĕch đei tơnơm phara kơdih kơdih.

English: All flesh is not the same flesh, but there is one kind of flesh of men, another flesh of animals, another of fish, and another of birds.
Bahnar: Na akâu kon bơngai, akâu kon sem brem kư̆m phara kiơ̆ kơ khŭl sư mơ̆n; akâu kon bơngai pha, akâu kon sem brem pha, akâu sem păr pha, akâu ka kư̆m pha mơ̆n.

English: There are also celestial bodies and terrestrial bodies; but the glory of the celestial is one, and the glory of the terrestrial is another.
Bahnar: Dôm tơmam tơ kơpal plĕnh ti, wă khan thoi lĕ kơ sơnglŏng, sư pha; dôm tơmam Sư pơjing tơ ala teh âu pha. Gah tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ sư, tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ khei sơnglŏng sư 'lơ̆ng rŏ, mă tơmam ala teh sư kư̆m 'lơ̆ng rŏ mơ̆n, mă tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ sư phara.

English: There is one glory of the sun, another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars; for one star differs from another star in glory.
Bahnar: Măt 'năr sư 'lơ̆ng rŏ, măt khei kư̆m 'lơ̆ng rŏ mơ̆n, mă lu sơnglŏng kư̆m 'lơ̆ng rŏ mơ̆n, mă tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ sư phara. Sơnglŏng 'noh 'lơ̆ng rŏ thoi noh, sơnglŏng to 'lơ̆ng rŏ thoi to.

English: So also is the resurrection of the dead. The body is sown in corruption, it is raised in incorruption.
Bahnar: Gah tơdrong iung arih đơ̆ng lôch kư̆m lei-lăi thoi noh mơ̆n. Akâu kon bơngai bơ̆n iung arih ning-mônh phara, ưh kơ thoi akâu bơ̆n mă oei arih dang ei ôh. Akâu bơ̆n lôch boih na đe 'bŭ akâu bơ̆n tơ teh, mưh 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih bơ̆n ning-mônh Sư wă ăn kơ bơ̆n akâu 'nao pran kơtang ưh kơ layơ lôch.

English: It is sown in dishonor, it is raised in glory. It is sown in weakness, it is raised in power.
Bahnar: Đe 'bŭ akâu bơ̆n tơ teh ưh pă yua kiơ dơ̆ng, mă-lei mưh Sư tơiung arih, akâu bơ̆n jing 'lơ̆ng rŏ. Đe 'bŭ akâu bơ̆n tơ teh ưh kơ pran ôh, mă-lei mưh Sư tơiung arih, akâu bơ̆n jing pran.

English: It is sown a natural body, it is raised a spiritual body. There is a natural body, and there is a spiritual body.
Bahnar: Akâu bơ̆n mă đe 'bŭ tơ teh, na sơ̆ akâu bơ̆n noh akâu bơngai ala teh, bơ̆n gơh tơbôl hăm bơngai ala teh, gơh pơma dơnuh hăm bơngai ala teh; mă-lei mưh Sư tơiung arih bơ̆n ning-mônh, bơngai bơ̆n đei akâu 'nao gơh oei hơdai hăm Yang, tơbôl hăm Yang. Dah kon bơngai bơ̆n đei akâu tơ ala teh âu, bơ̆n kư̆m gô đei akâu tơ plĕnh ti mơ̆n.

English: And so it is written, “The first man Adam became a living being.” The last Adam became a life-giving spirit.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei đe đei chih boih thoi âu: “Bơngai kơ đĭ-đăng hơdrol sơ̆ jĭ 'bok Ađam, 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư đei akâu đei jơhngơ̆m wă kơ gơh arih.” Na 'bok Ađam mă hơtuch âu, wă khan Yêsu Krist, Sư Yang wă anhăk đĭ-đăng kon bơngai oei hơdai hăm Sư arih ling-lang.

English: However, the spiritual is not first, but the natural, and afterward the spiritual.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh đei akâu wă tơbôl hơdai hăm Yang hơdrol ôh, bơ̆n gơh tơbôl hăm bơngai bơ̆n 'mơ̆i hơdrol, klaih kơ noh na gơh tơbôl kơ Yang dơ̆ng.

English: The first man was of the earth, made of dust; the second Man is the Lord from heaven.
Bahnar: Bơngai kơ đĭ-đăng hơdrol sơ̆, sư đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing sư păng teh, man sư păng 'mui teh; na bơngai mă 'bar 'noh Sư jur đơ̆ng plĕnh.

English: As was the man of dust, so also are those who are made of dust; and as is the heavenly Man, so also are those who are heavenly.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă 'Bok Kei-Dei man sư păng 'mui teh, đĭ-đăng kon bơngai ala teh kư̆m lei-lăi thoi sư ngăl; bơngai mă jur đơ̆ng plĕnh, wă khan Yêsu Krist, na đĭ-đăng lu bơngai lui kơ Sư kư̆m lei-lăi thoi Sư mơ̆n ning-mônh.

English: And as we have borne the image of the man of dust, we shall also bear the image of the heavenly Man.
Bahnar: Kư̆m thoi bơ̆n đei kơdih boih akâu đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei man păng teh, na ning-mônh bơ̆n kư̆m đei lei-lăi thoi akâu Yêsu mă jur đơ̆ng plĕnh mơ̆n.

English: Now this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God; nor does corruption inherit incorruption.
Bahnar: Ơ 'nhŏng oh, inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, sĕch akar kon bơngai bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh oei tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh, yua kơ sĕch akar bơ̆n juăt kơ ôm hach. Tơ dêh char Sư ưh kơ đei kiơ jing ôm hach.

English: Behold, I tell you a mystery: We shall not all sleep, but we shall all be changed
Bahnar: Na dang ei inh wă khan ăn kơ iĕm minh tơdrong hrĕp tam mă tơbăt kơ đe đơ̆ng sơ̆: Kon bơngai bơ̆n, 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ ăn lôch đĭ ôh, đĭ-đăng kơ bơngai mă lôch mă oei arih tơplih hloi akâu 'nao. Kơđei kơ minh tơtĕp măt, lăp bơ̆n kơtơ̆ng đe hlôm keng năr tôch; đe hlôm na bơngai lôch iung arih hloi ưh pă đei ôm hach boih, na bơ̆n mă oei arih kư̆m tơplih hloi akâu 'nao mơ̆n.

English: in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet. For the trumpet will sound, and the dead will be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.
Bahnar: Na dang ei inh wă khan ăn kơ iĕm minh tơdrong hrĕp tam mă tơbăt kơ đe đơ̆ng sơ̆: Kon bơngai bơ̆n, 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ ăn lôch đĭ ôh, đĭ-đăng kơ bơngai mă lôch mă oei arih tơplih hloi akâu 'nao. Kơđei kơ minh tơtĕp măt, lăp bơ̆n kơtơ̆ng đe hlôm keng năr tôch; đe hlôm na bơngai lôch iung arih hloi ưh pă đei ôm hach boih, na bơ̆n mă oei arih kư̆m tơplih hloi akâu 'nao mơ̆n.

English: For this corruptible must put on incorruption, and this mortal must put on immortality.
Bahnar: Yua kơ akâu bơ̆n ling-lang kơ ôm hach na bơ̆n athei iŏk tơplih akâu 'nao mă ưh kơ layơ ôm hach; akâu bơ̆n ling-lang kơ lôch bơ̆n athei iŏk tơplih akâu 'nao mă ưh kơ layơ lôch.

English: So when this corruptible has put on incorruption, and this mortal has put on immortality, then shall be brought to pass the saying that is written: “Death is swallowed up in victory.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh akâu bơ̆n mă ling-lang kơ ôm hach, iŏk tơplih boih akâu 'nao mă ưh kơ ôm hach, akâu bơ̆n ling-lang kơ lôch, iŏk tơplih boih akâu 'nao mă ưh kơ lôch, 'noh 'blep trŏ thoi đe chih khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆ thoi âu: “Tơdrong lôch ưh pă đei boih, jei bơ̆n boih.”

English: “O Death, where is your sting? O Hades, where is your victory?”
Bahnar: “Ơ tơdrong lôch, tơ yơ jei e? Ơ tơdrong lôch, tơ yơ e gơh pơrăm nhôn dơ̆ng?”

English: The sting of death is sin, and the strength of sin is the law.
Bahnar: Tơdrong yoch pơm kơ bơ̆n lôch răm păng yua kơ bơ̆n ưh kơ kĕ kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei, na bơ̆n yoch rai dêh.

English: But thanks be to God, who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư mơnat ăn jei bơ̆n yua kơ Kră Yang bơ̆n Yêsu Krist lôch tang bơ̆n.

English: Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I have given orders to the churches of Galatia, so you must do also
Bahnar: Bĭ gah tơdrong pơyơ̆r jên wă tơgŭm lu bơngai lui tơ dêh Juđê, inh wă kơ iĕm pơm kiơ̆ thoi inh pơkă kơ lu bơngai lui tơ dêh Galati.

English: On the first day of the week let each one of you lay something aside, storing up as he may prosper, that there be no collections when I come.
Bahnar: Rim năr mônh, rim 'nu kơ iĕm pơyơ̆r jên kơdih kơdih, kiơ̆ kơ jơhngơ̆m iĕm wă păng kiơ̆ kơ tơmam iĕm đei. Thoi noh lăp inh truh tơ iĕm, na iĕm pơyơ̆r tôm boih, huay pă kăl pơyơ̆r dơ̆ng.

English: And when I come, whomever you approve by your letters I will send to bear your gift to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Lăp inh truh tơ iĕm, na lu bơngai mă iĕm rơih đơ̆ng lăm lu iĕm 'noh, inh wă wơh lu sư năm ăn tơmam đơ̆ng iĕm pơyơ̆r tơgŭm ăn kơ lu bơngai lui tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Inh kư̆m wă chih kơthơ mơ̆n wă ăn kơ lu sư chĕp ba kơ lu kră bơngai lui tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem wă kơ lu sư băt.

English: But if it is fitting that I go also, they will go with me.
Bahnar: Păng dah kăl kơ tơ'ngla inh wang năm kư̆m bưh mơ̆n, lei đe 'noh năm hơdai hăm inh.

English: Now I will come to you when I pass through Macedonia (for I am passing through Macedonia).
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ inh năm tơ dêh Masêđôn, inh wă năm tơ iĕm, yua kơ inh wă năm tơ dêh Masêđôn hơdrol 'mơ̆i.

English: And it may be that I will remain, or even spend the winter with you, that you may send me on my journey, wherever I go.
Bahnar: Rŏ lăng inh oei hơdai iĕm đunh 'biơ̆, truh đơ̆ng rŏng kơ bơyan puih thâu, na đơ̆ng noh iĕm gơh tơgŭm inh mă năm tơ yơ yơ.

English: For I do not wish to see you now on the way; but I hope to stay a while with you, if the Lord permits.
Bahnar: 'Nâu ưh kơ sĭ inh wă drong ngôi đĕch ôh, inh wă oei hơdai iĕm đunh 'biơ̆ mơ̆n, dah Kră Yang ăn.

English: But I will tarry in Ephesus until Pentecost.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dang ei inh wă oei tơ Pơlei Êphêsô truh kơ Năr Giĕng Pangtơkôt 'mơ̆i na năm tơ iĕm

English: For a great and effective door has opened to me, and there are many adversaries.
Bahnar: yua kơ tơ Êphêsô âu dang lĕ trong rơwơn pơchoh ăn kơ inh jang 'biơ̆, mă-lei kư̆m đei lơ bơngai wă ayăt kơ nhôn mơ̆n.

English: And if Timothy comes, see that he may be with you without fear; for he does the work of the Lord, as I also do.
Bahnar: Lăp Timôthê năm tơ iĕm, iĕm athei sơng iŏk sư tơpă hŏ, wă kơ sư huay kơ hli dah mơlâu, yua kơ sư jang tơdrong Kră Yang Yêsu Krist kư̆m lei-lăi thoi inh mơ̆n.

English: Therefore let no one despise him. But send him on his journey in peace, that he may come to me; for I am waiting for him with the brethren.
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ pơdê sư. Lăp sư yak đơ̆ng iĕm wih tơ inh, iĕm athei tơgŭm 'biơ̆ hŏ, wă kơ sư hiôk păng dang ei inh oei chang gô sư hăm đĭ kơ bôl sư wih tơ inh tơ âu.

English: Now concerning our brother Apollos, I strongly urged him to come to you with the brethren, but he was quite unwilling to come at this time; however, he will come when he has a convenient time.
Bahnar: Gah 'nhŏng bơ̆n Apôlê, inh pơlung sư khŏm khŏm athei sư năm ngôi tơ iĕm hơdai lu 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n ră, mă-lei sư ưh kơ yĕng năm ngôi tơ iĕm dang ei ôh, gô sư wăn ning-mônh na sư năm ngôi.

English: Watch, stand fast in the faith, be brave, be strong.
Bahnar: Inh athei iĕm kơchăng ling-lang pơkrơ̆ng mă kơjăp tơdrong lui 'nĕ kơdŭn.

English: Let all that you do be done with love.
Bahnar: Mă dôm tơdrong jang, iĕm athei băt tơchĕng 'mêm mơnat kơ đe.

English: I urge you, brethren—you know the household of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruits of Achaia, and that they have devoted themselves to the ministry of the saints
Bahnar: Iĕm kư̆m băt mơ̆n Sêphanna păng hnam dơnŏ sư, lu sư lui kơ Kră Yang hơdrol kơ đe lăm dêh Grĕk, lu sư adrin tơgŭm lu bơngai lui ling-lang.

English: that you also submit to such, and to everyone who works and labors with us.
Bahnar: Ơ 'nhŏng oh, inh athei iĕm chu yom kơ sư păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai mă gơh jang thoi sư noh.

English: I am glad about the coming of Stephanas, Fortunatus, and Achaicus, for what was lacking on your part they supplied.
Bahnar: Inh chhơp kơ jơhngơ̆m inh tơpă yua kơ inh 'bôh đe Sêphanna, Phơttuna păng Achaikơ đơ̆ng iĕm năm ngôi tơ inh. Inh rơnguơ̆ đĭ-đăng kơ iĕm ră, mă-lei 'bôh lu sư boih, dang 'bôh iĕm mơ̆n.

English: For they refreshed my spirit and yours. Therefore acknowledge such men.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm kơ jơhngơ̆m inh hiôk păng pơm kơ jơhngơ̆m iĕm hiôk lei-lăi mơ̆n. Na iĕm athei chu yom kơ dôm lu bơngai mă pơm thoi noh.

English: The churches of Asia greet you. Aquila and Priscilla greet you heartily in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.
Bahnar: Lu khŭl lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ dêh Asi đei nơ̆r jet gia iĕm. 'Bok Akila, yă Prisil păng đĭ dôm lu bơngai lui juăt kơ akŭm tơ hnam bre sư kư̆m đei nơ̆r jet gia iĕm mơ̆n yua kơ bơ̆n minh khŭl bơngai lui kơ Kră Yang.

English: All the brethren greet you. Greet one another with a holy kiss.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kơ 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n mă oei hơdai hăm inh, lu sư đei nơ̆r jet gia pơma dơnuh kơ iĕm. Na apinh iĕm sơng iŏk rôp băl ti wă kơ băt tơdrong 'mêm băl hŏ.

English: The salutation with my own hand—Paul’s.
Bahnar: Kơthơ âu nơ̆r inh pơma, buăl inh chih. Lăp wă jê̆ tôch na ti inh Pôl chih kơdih.

English: If anyone does not love the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be accursed. O Lord, come!
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ưh kơ 'mêm kơ Kră Yang Yêsu, bơngai 'noh sư đei tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak sư. Ơ Kră Yang Yêsu, jur bĕ, dah jur tơ nhôn.

English: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
Bahnar: Inh apinh Kră Yang Yêsu Krist wei-lăng iĕm lăm tôm tơdrong.

English: My love be with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.
Bahnar: Inh 'mêm mơnat kơ iĕm yua kơ bơ̆n 'nhŏng oh lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu Krist. A-men.
